src.game
Class GameWorld

java.lang.Object
  src.game.GameWorld

public class GameWorld
extends java.lang.Object

Singleton class. Keeps track of the maps in the current game. Contains a collection of players. This is in case networking is implemented later.

Author:
Darren Watts date 11/11/07

getClosestPlayer

public Player getClosestPlayer(int row,
                               int col)
Will return the player closest to the land object at row and column. For now, this will just be the only player, but if networking is implemented later, this method would actually do something.

Parameters:
row - : int
col - : int

getGameWorld

public Land[][] getGameWorld(int row,
                             int col)
Gets the gameworld relative player from the landArray. It will return the land[][] within the player's view. Automatically sets up the Outside objects (trees), so they do not need to be included in the array.

Parameters:
row - Row number as an int.
col - Column number as an int.
Returns:
The world as a Land[][].

getLocalPlayer

Player : local player

resetCities

public void resetCities()
Erases all information from the cities. Starts fresh.

newCity

public void newCity(java.lang.String name,
                    int rows,
                    int cols)
             throws CityNameExistsException
Adds a new level with the specified level name, rows and columns. This is used by the editor when starting a new level. It will initialize the map so the outer edge of the map are undestroyable obstructions, and the rest of the map is made of streets.

Parameters:
name - String : level name
rows - int : rows
cols - int : columns
Throws:
CityNameExistsException

removeCity

public void removeCity(int level)
Removes the specified city from the world.

Parameters:
level - int : level index

randomizeLevel

public void randomizeLevel()
Uses the current level and randomizes it so it fits a dungeon pattern. It will reset all of the obstructions to wall 1, and all streets to street 0. All of the objects will be removed.

randomFix

private void randomFix(int row,
                       int col)
Tries to create paths from the existing set of streets.

Parameters:
row - int : row of tile to create path around
col - int : column of tile to create path around

createRandomStreet

private void createRandomStreet(int row,
                                int col,
                                double rand)
Creates a street next to the tile at the given row and column. It will decide which direction to create the opening based on the random number given.

Parameters:
row - int : row of tile to create street next to.
col - int : column of tile to create street next to.
rand - double : random number used to determine which direction the street will be created from the given tile.

createRandomObstruction

private void createRandomObstruction(int row,
                                     int col,
                                     double rand)
Creates an obstruction next to the tile at the given row and column. It will decide which direction to create the wall based on the random number given.

Parameters:
row - int : row of tile to create obstruction next to.
col - int : column of tile to create obstruction next to.
rand - double : random number used to determine which direction the obstruction will be created from the given tile.

diagonalFix

private void diagonalFix(int row,
                         int col)
Checks the diagonals of the given tile to make sure at least one of them is a wall. This will make sure that there are no large openings that the dungeon renderer cannot draw correctly.

Parameters:
row - int : row of the tile to check for diagonals at.
col - int : column of the tile to check for diagonals at.

resizeLevel

public void resizeLevel(int rows,
                        int cols,
                        boolean bottom,
                        boolean right)
Resizes the level to fit the specified row and columns. It will expand or compress different parts of the map depending on what the bottom and right variables are set to. For example, if the bottom variable is set, it will expand or shrink the bottom of the existing map, preserving what exists for the map that is above that point. If bottom is not set, it will expand or shrink from the top. The right variable works the same way, except it works with the right and left sides of the map.

Parameters:
rows - int : new number of rows
cols - int : new number of columns
bottom - boolean : expand/shrink bottom of map
right - boolean : expand/shrink right of map

forceNonDestroyableEdge

private void forceNonDestroyableEdge(Land[][] newLand,
                                     int row,
                                     int col,
                                     int rows,
                                     int cols)
Checks to see what the land object is at the specified row and column to see if it needs to be made non destroyable. This is used when resizing the level, and you want to make sure that all the boundary walls are non destroyable.

Parameters:
newLand - Land[][] the land to check
row - int : row
col - int : column
rows - int : number of rows in the land
cols - int : number of columns in the land

                  Direction direction)
           throws PlayerEnteredException,
                  EnemyDiedException

Parameters:
plr - The player entering
direction - Direction player wants to move.
Throws:
PlayerEnteredException
EnemyDiedException

activateEnemyAI

public void activateEnemyAI()
For every enemy in view of a player, this will tell the enemy to activate. Adds each enemy in view into an arraylist and activates them once they've all been accounted for. This way enemies won't get activated more than once.

checkExits

public boolean checkExits()
Checks to see whether or not the exits should be open or closed. If the exits should be closed, the method returns false, true if they should be open.

Returns:
boolean : whether or not the gates of the exits should open.

fillCheckExitsArray

private void fillCheckExitsArray()
Finds the dungeons that are on the current level, and calls the checkDungeons method to find all of the levels connected to those dungeons.

checkDungeons

private void checkDungeons()
Recursively checks all levels listed in the checkExitsArray to fill up the checkExitsArray with all of the dungeons connected to the current dungeon system.

openGates

public boolean openGates()
Opens the gates in the game world if any can be open. If none can be opened on the current level, check to see if the game should end.

Returns:
boolean : whether or not the game ended.

triggerWorldUpdate

public void triggerWorldUpdate()
Updates everything in the world.

triggerEnemies

public void triggerEnemies(Player plr,
                           StreetType trig)
Spawns enemies around the player based on the type of trigger.

Parameters:
plr - Player : the player to spawn enemies around
trig - TriggerType : kind of trigger that was activated

getBulletBoundaryBetween

public boolean getBulletBoundaryBetween(Player plr,
                                        Enemy enemy)
Checks to see if there is a boundary between the given player and enemy to see if there is a barrier between them that will stop projectils from passing through. This method assumes that the enemy is within visual distance of the player and shares either a row or column with the player or that the enemy is perfectly diagonal to the player.

Parameters:
plr - Player : the player
enemy - Enemy : the enemy
Returns:
boolean : whether there is a boundary that stops bullets
